subject: Leadership
title: The Innovator's Dilemma
description: Learn The Innovator's Dilemma in one minute.

hook.text: Blockbuster was worth $5 billion. They passed on buying Netflix for $50 million. Ten years later, they were bankrupt.

buildup.text: Christensen showed that successful companies fail by doing what made them successful: serving current customers.

discovery.text: Disruptive innovation starts small and inferior, then improves until it overtakes incumbents who ignored it too long.

twist.text: The dilemma: investing in disruption cannibalizes your current business. Not investing lets someone else do it instead.

climax.text: Leaders navigate by creating separate units for disruptive bets, protecting them from the core business's gravity.

punchline.text: If you won't disrupt yourself, someone else will.

quiz.question: What is the innovator's dilemma?
options: Serving current customers blinds you to disruption
